method.name: SetOutputVolume
method.tp:docstring: Sets the volume of the system.

arg.name: volume
arg.tp:docstring: Volume ranges from 0 to 100, and will be translated to dB based on the output-specific volume curve.

method.name: SetOutputNodeVolume
method.tp:docstring: Sets the volume of the given node.

arg.name: volume
arg.tp:docstring: Volume ranges from 0 to 100, and will be translated to dB based on the output-specific volume curve.

method.name: SwapLeftRight
method.tp:docstring: Swap the left and right channel of the given node. Message will be dropped if this feature is not supported.

method.name: SetDisplayRotation
method.tp:docstring: Set the display rotation state with the enum CRAS_SCREEN_ROTATION which is aligned with display::Display::Rotation in ui/display/display.h. Message will be dropped if this feature is not supported.

method.name: SetOutputMute
method.tp:docstring: Sets the system output mute.

method.name: SetOutputUserMute
method.tp:docstring: Sets the system output mute from user action.

method.name: SetInputNodeGain
method.tp:docstring: Sets the capture gain of the node.

arg.name: gain
arg.tp:docstring: gain is a 0-100 integer which linearly maps [0, 50] to range [-20dB, 0dB] and [50, 100] to [0dB, 20dB], Default gain value is 50, which is 0dB.

method.name: SetInputMute
method.tp:docstring: Sets the capture mute state of the system. Recordings will be muted when this is set.

method.name: GetVolumeState
method.tp:docstring: Returns the volume and capture gain.

method.name: GetDefaultOutputBufferSize
method.tp:docstring: Returns the default output buffer size in frames.

method.name: GetNodes
method.tp:docstring:
Returns information about nodes. A node can be either output or input but not both. An output node is something like a speaker or a headphone, and an input node is like a microphone. The return value is a sequence of dicts mapping from strings to variants (e.g. signature "a{sv}a{sv}" for two nodes). Each dict contains information about a node.
Each dict contains the following properties: boolean IsInput false for output nodes, true for input nodes. uint64 Id The id of this node. It is unique among all nodes including both output and input nodes. string Type The type of this node. It can be one of following values: /* for output nodes. */ "INTERNAL_SPEAKER","HEADPHONE", "HDMI", /* for input nodes. */ "INTERNAL_MIC", "MIC", /* for both output and input nodes. */ "USB", "BLUETOOTH", "UNKNOWN", string Name The name of this node. For example, "Speaker" or "Internal Mic". string DeviceName The name of the device that this node belongs to. For example, "HDA Intel PCH: CA0132 Analog:0,0" or "Creative SB Arena Headset". uint64 StableDeviceId The stable ID does not change due to device plug/unplug or reboot. uint64 StableDeviceIdNew The new stable ID. Keeping both stable ID and stable ID new is for backward compatibility. uint32 DeviceLastOpenResult The last known result of opening the device. It is 0 for unknown, 1 for success and 2 for failure. boolean Active Whether this node is currently used for output/input. There is one active node for output and one active node for input. uint64 PluggedTime The time that this device was plugged in. This value is in microseconds. uint64 NodeVolume The node volume indexed from 0 to 100. uint64 NodeCaptureGain The capture gain of node in dBFS * 100. It's not used by any clients. uint32 InputNodeGain The input node gain set by UI. Its value ranges from 0 to 100. string HotwordModels A string of comma-separated hotword language model locales supported by this node. e.g. "en_au,en_gb,en_us" The string is empty if the node type is not HOTWORD. uint32 NodeAudioEffect The support information of audio effects in bit-wise manner, which is defined by enum "audio_effect_type" in src/common/cras_iodev_info.h.

method.name: GetNodeInfos
method.tp:docstring: Similar to GetNodes, but this one returns an array of dict and has signature "aa{sv}". Clients using chromeos-dbus-bindings should use this method instead of "GetNodes".

method.name: GetSystemAecSupported
method.tp:docstring: Returns 1 if system echo cancellation is supported, otherwise return 0.

method.name: GetSystemNsSupported
method.tp:docstring: Returns 1 if system noise suppression is supported, otherwise return 0.

method.name: GetSystemAgcSupported
method.tp:docstring: Returns 1 if system automatic gain control is supported, otherwise return 0.

method.name: GetRtcRunning
method.tp:docstring: Returns true if there are running RTC streams, otherwise return false.

method.name: SetActiveOutputNode
method.tp:docstring: Requests the specified node to be used for output. If node_id is 0 (which is not a valid node id), cras will choose the active node automatically.

method.name: SetActiveInputNode
method.tp:docstring: Requests the specified node to be used for input. If node_id is 0 (which is not a valid node id), cras will choose the active node automatically.

method.name: GetNumberOfActiveStreams
method.tp:docstring: Returns the number of streams currently being played or recorded.

method.name: GetNumberOfActiveOutputStreams
method.tp:docstring: Returns the number of streams currently using output hardware.

method.name: GetNumberOfActiveInputStreams
method.tp:docstring: Returns the number of streams currently using input hardware.

method.name: SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix
method.tp:docstring: Sets the conversion matrix for global output channel remixing. The coefficient array represents an N * N conversion matrix M, where N is num_channels, with M[i][j] = coefficient[i * N + j]. The remix is done by multiplying the conversion matrix to each N-channel PCM data, i.e M * [L, R] = [L', R'] For example, coefficient [0.1, 0.9, 0.4, 0.6] will result in: L' = 0.1 * L + 0.9 * R R' = 0.4 * L + 0.6 * R

method.name: SetHotwordModel
method.tp:docstring: Set the hotword language model on the specified node. The node must have type HOTWORD and the model_name must be one of the supported locales returned by GetNodes() HotwordModels string. Returns 0 on success, or a negative errno on failure.

method.name: IsAudioOutputActive
method.tp:docstring: Returns 1 if there are currently any active output streams, excluding 'fake' streams that are not actually outputting any audio. Returns 0 if there are no active streams, or all active streams are 'fake' streams.

method.name: SetForceSrBtEnabled
method.tp:docstring: Set the force sr bt enabled state to `enabled`. Caution: This method is for testing purpose.

method.name: GetForceSrBtEnabled
method.tp:docstring: Returns the state of the force sr bt enabled. Caution: This method is for testing purpose.

method.name: SetSpeakOnMuteDetection
method.tp:docstring: Enable or disable speak-on-mute detection.

method.name: SpeakOnMuteDetectionEnabled
method.tp:docstring: Get whether speak-on-mute detection is enabled.

method.name: IsInternalCardDetected
method.tp:docstring: Returns 1 if at least 1 internal audio card that is not HDMI audio card is detected. Returns 0 if no internal audio cards are detected.

method.name: GetNumberOfNonChromeOutputStreams
method.tp:docstring: Returns the number of active output streams, excluding those from Chrome and LaCrOS.

signal.name: OutputVolumeChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the output volume level has changed.

signal.name: OutputMuteChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the output mute state has changed.

arg.name: muted
arg.tp:docstring: true if the system is muted by a system process, such as suspend or device switch.

arg.name: user_muted
arg.tp:docstring: true if the system has been muted by user action such as the mute key.

signal.name: InputGainChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates what the system capture gain is now.

signal.name: InputMuteChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the input mute state has changed.

signal.name: ActiveOutputNodeChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the active output node has changed.

signal.name: ActiveInputNodeChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the active input node has changed.

signal.name: OutputNodeVolumeChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates the volume of the given node.

signal.name: InputNodeGainChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that the capture gain for the node is now.

signal.name: NodeLeftRightSwappedChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates the left and right channel swapping state of the given node.

signal.name: NumberOfActiveStreamsChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates the number of active streams has changed.

signal.name: NumberOfNonChromeOutputStreamsChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates the number of active output streams, excluding those from Chrome and LaCrOS has changed.

signal.name: HotwordTriggered
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates that hotword was triggered at the given timestamp.

signal.name: AudioOutputActiveStateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates active output state has changed. See IsAudioOutputActive for details.

signal.name: SevereUnderrun
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates severe underrun. Rate limited to 1 per 5 seconds.

signal.name: Underrun
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates underrun. Rate limited to 1 per 10 seconds.

signal.name: SurveyTrigger
signal.tp:docstring: Indicates an audio survey should be triggered.

signal.name: SpeakOnMuteDetected
signal.tp:docstring: Signal that indicates voice activity is detected. This signal is only sent when all the following are true: (1) the system microphone is muted (2) voice activity detected (3) speak-on-mute detection is turned on with SetSpeakOnMuteDetection (4) there is an ongoing WebRTC usage. (5) this signal was not sent in the past 1 second
